item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Trim Modulating Valve(s)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated valve is secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
Trim air is not available to the conditioned air supplied to the compartment.

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard associated Lower Lobe Temp selector "TRIM AIR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Trim Modulating Valve closed:
Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Remove the aft right hand air conditioning equipment bay panel 192MR to access forward cargo trim air Modulation valve (STA 1208, WL 100, RBL 105).
Disconnect, cap, and stow valve’s electrical connector.
Manually position the valve in the closed position (requires an Allen wrench).
Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers
In the cockpit the Status message ZONE TEMP will remain displayed.
To secure Aft Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Trim Modulating Valve closed:
Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Locate Aft Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Trim Modulating Valve located in right body landing gear wheel well on inboard bulkhead (STA 1436, WL 155, RBL 7).
Disconnect, cap, and stow valve’s electrical connector.
Manually position the valve in the closed position (will require an Allen wrench).
Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
In the cockpit the Status message ZONE TEMP will remain displayed.
